text:
I think im missing something but unsure. does anyone knwo why this is returning just `1.0`  when I expect `1.3333`
`{{ 16|divide(12.0)|float }}`

never mind, I had to float `16`
`{{ 16|float|divide(12.0)|float }}`

I presume this should be displaying the right colour as default instead of the variable name? :disappointed: It actually stops me from saving the page.

```{% module 'The consultation' path='../modules/single-cta'  background_color='{"color":"{{ theme.global_colors.additional_1_color.color }}"}'%}```

Greetings everyone. Is it possible to query blog posts via a custom field? For example, we want to assign each blog post a “topic” value and then show lists of blog posts by type value in modules on other pages. I know we could do this with tags but looking to be more structured. Thanks in advance.
We’d want to do the same with landing pages.
